newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-News confirms wants to sell ANM stake.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-News confirms wants to sell ANM stake.

text.p: News Corp Ltd confirmed on Monday that it was trying to sell its 50 percent stake in Australian Newsprint Mills (ANM).
"I can confirm that our stake is up for sale," a News Ltd official told Reuters.
News could not make any further comment, the official said.
Earlier on Monday, The Sydney Morning Herald reported that News had engaged investment bank Baring Bros Burrows to hunt for a buyer for the stake.

News had aimed to sell the stake to fellow 50 percent ANM shareholder, Fletcher Challenge Ltd, for A$300 million, but Fletcher refused as it was only prepared to pay half that amount, the newspaper said.
Fletcher, however, maintained it had the first right to buy the Australian Newsprint Mills stake.
"This means that if News finds a buyer Fletcher will have the right to match the bid or possible vetor the proposed buyer," the Herald said.
Australian Newsprint Mills supplies about 70 percent of Australia's newsprint market.
News reportedly told analysts last month it wanted to sell about US$800 million worth of assets to finance its expansion into U.S. satellite television.
